isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14618 AND RTLO-16618 SERIES - INSTALL - AUXILIARY SECTION AND SHIMMING PROCEDURE

step1.para: Tighten the middle bolt on each countershaft strap until the countershafts are snug. Shift the reduction sliding clutch into reduction. Attach a chain hoist to the output shaft.

note.para: The front box sliding clutches must be in the neutral position.

step1.para: With the transmission set in the vertical position, block under the clutch housing to prevent damage to the input shaft, and position the new gasket on the transmission case ( Figure 282). Lower the auxiliary assembly on the front case rear.

figure.caption: Figure 282. Position New Gasket on Transmission Case

important.para: Shift the reduction sliding clutch into deep reduction before installing the auxiliary.

step1.para: Apply Loctite 242 or equivalent to the retaining bolt threads and install in the housing flange ( Figure 283). Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m).

figure.caption: Figure 283. Install Retaining Bolts in Housing Flange

step1.para: Remove the countershaft straps. Make sure a 0.125 countershaft rear bearing shim is installed ( Figure 284). Be sure the countershaft rear bearing races are seated in the bearing bores.

figure.caption: Figure 284. Install Countershaft Rear Bearing Shim

step1.para: Install two clean 3/8" x 1" bolts without washers directly across from each other in each bearing cover ( Figure 285). Tapped holes in auxiliary case must be free of thread adhesive.

figure.caption: Figure 285. Install Bolts Without Washers Directly Across From Each Other in Each Bearing Cover

step1.para: Tighten the bolts to 7 in-lbs. (0.8 N·m). DO NOT INSTALL THE COUNTERSHAFT REAR BEARING COVER GASKET ( Figure 286).

Rotate the output shaft six times in the clockwise direction, then six times counterclockwise to seat the countershaft rear bearings. Use a feeler gauge, as close to one bolt location as possible, and measure the gap between the countershaft rear bearing cover and the auxiliary case ( Figure 287). Record the measurement. Using the average measurement, refer to the Shimming Chart
. Select the numbers in the left column that compare to the average measurement recorded from the countershaft rear bearing cover. Follow the column to the right to identify the proper shim to be used in the counter- shaft shim bores. Repeat this procedure for the other countershaft rear bearing cover.

figure.caption: Figure 287. Measure Gap Between Countershaft Rear Bearing Cover and Auxiliary Case

step1.para: Remove the countershaft rear bearing covers and gauging shims ( Figure 288).

figure.caption: Figure 288. Remove Countershaft Rear Bearing Covers and Gauging Shims

step1.para: After the correct shim has been selected, place the shim on the rear countershaft bearing race, and install the countershaft rear bearing cover and gasket ( Figure 289). Check for proper shim alignment. If misaligned, the rear bearing cover may be damaged when the cover bolts are tightened. Position a new gasket on each countershaft rear bearing cover mounting surface and install both rear bearing covers. Apply Loctite 242 or equivalent to the bolt threads. Install and tighten the bolts to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m).

figure.caption: Figure 289. Install Countershaft Rear Bearing Cover and Gasket
